skill.name: statsmodels
skill.description: Statistical modeling toolkit. OLS, GLM, logistic, ARIMA, time series, hypothesis tests, diagnostics, AIC/BIC, for rigorous statistical inference and econometric analysis.
skill.summary: Statistical modeling toolkit. OLS, GLM, logistic, ARIMA, time series, hypothesis tests, diagnostics,...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains instructional markdown files teaching statsmodels usage. No network calls, file access, or code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: You need rigorous statistical inference and model diagnostics. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for OLS, GLM, time series, and discrete choice models with statsmodels.
actual_capabilities: Explain OLS, WLS, GLS, and quantile regression setup and interpretation
Guide GLM family and link selection with Poisson, logistic, and Gamma examples
Outline discrete choice models including logit, probit, and count models
Detail ARIMA, SARIMAX, and exponential smoothing for forecasting
Describe statistical tests, assumption checks, and influence diagnostics
limitations: Does not execute code or return computed results
Requires Python and statsmodels installed by the user
Does not provide dataset-specific statistical results
Does not replace domain expertise for causal inference

use_cases.title: Choose regression model
use_cases.description: Select appropriate regression type based on outcome variable and validate with diagnostic tests.

use_cases.title: Validate model assumptions
use_cases.description: Run heteroskedasticity, autocorrelation, and influence diagnostics for robust inference.

use_cases.title: Build time series forecast
use_cases.description: Specify ARIMA parameters, test stationarity, and generate prediction intervals.

prompt_templates.title: Pick regression model
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a continuous outcome with covariates
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend the best statsmodels regression family for my outcome and explain why. List required diagnostics and key outputs to report.

prompt_templates.title: Plan GLM analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: You have count data with overdispersion
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GLM analysis plan in statsmodels for count data. Include Poisson fit, overdispersion check, and Negative Binomial transition.

prompt_templates.title: Design discrete choice study
prompt_templates.scenario: You predict a categorical outcome with multiple classes
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a statsmodels discrete choice approach for multiple unordered classes. Include model selection, marginal effects, and evaluation metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Build ARIMA workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to forecast time series data
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an ARIMA workflow in statsmodels with stationarity tests, ACF PACF guidance, order selection, and forecast validation steps.

output_examples.input: Outline a diagnostics checklist for an OLS model
output: Verify constant term added with sm.add_constant()
Run Breusch-Pagan test for heteroskedasticity and report p-value
Check residual autocorrelation with Durbin-Watson or Ljung-Box test
Inspect influence using Cook distance threshold 4/n
Calculate VIF for multicollinearity and condition number
Compare AIC BIC across nested model candidates

best_practices: Start with simple models and add complexity based on diagnostic results
Report confidence intervals alongside point estimates and p-values
Validate predictions with holdout set or cross-validation before making claims
anti_patterns: Use OLS for binary or count outcomes instead of GLM families
Ignore heteroskedasticity or autocorrelation warnings without remediation
Compare non-nested models using likelihood ratio tests

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides platform-agnostic guidance for any prompt-based AI assistant workflow.

faq.question: What are the key limitations?
faq.answer: It does not execute code or compute results. You must run statsmodels in your own Python environment.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing analysis pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use it to plan analysis steps and map outputs, then implement in your Python pipeline.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it contains only documentation and makes no file system or network connections.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot model convergence issues?
faq.answer: Check variable scaling, model specification, and data quality. Review statsmodels warnings and consider alternative families.

faq.question: How does this differ from general statistics guides?
faq.answer: It is tailored specifically to statsmodels API patterns, diagnostics, and workflow conventions.
